trans-unit.source: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that can be moved, resized, or rotated within a two-dimensional space.
Implemented on a UI Automation provider that must support the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TransformPattern> control pattern.
Support for this control pattern is not limited to objects on the desktop.
This control pattern must also be implemented by the children of a container object as long as the children can be moved, resized, or rotated freely within the boundaries of the container.
Gets a value that specifies whether the control can be moved.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element can be moved; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that specifies whether the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element can be resized.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element can be resized; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that specifies whether the control can be rotated.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element can be rotated; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Moves the control.
An object cannot be moved, resized, or rotated such that its resulting screen location would be completely outside the coordinates of its container and inaccessible to keyboard or mouse.
For example, when a top-level window is moved completely off-screen or a child object is moved outside the boundaries of the container's viewport.
In these cases the object is placed as close to the requested screen coordinates as possible with the top or left coordinates overridden to be within the container boundaries.
Absolute screen coordinates of the left side of the control.
Absolute screen coordinates of the top of the control.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.CanMove*> property is false.
Resizes the control.
When called on a control that supports split panes, this method can have the side effect of resizing other contiguous panes.
An object cannot be moved, resized, or rotated such that its resulting screen location would be completely outside the coordinates of its container and inaccessible to keyboard or mouse.
For example, when a top-level window is moved completely off-screen or a child object is moved outside the boundaries of the container's viewport.
In these cases the object is placed as close to the requested screen coordinates as possible with the top or left coordinates overridden to be within the container boundaries.
The new width of the window, in pixels.
The new height of the window, in pixels.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.CanResize*> property is false.
Rotates the control.
An object cannot be moved, resized or rotated such that its resulting screen location would be completely outside the coordinates of its container and inaccessible to keyboard or mouse.
For example, when a top-level window is moved completely off-screen or a child object is moved outside the boundaries of the container's viewport.
In these cases the object is placed as close to the requested screen coordinates as possible with the top or left coordinates overridden to be within the container boundaries.
The number of degrees to rotate the control.
A positive number rotates clockwise; a negative number rotates counterclockwise.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.CanRotate*> property is false.
